instruction: Outline the differences between vinegar and lemon juice.
output: Vinegar is a weak acid made from the fermentation of ethanol while lemon juice is made from the fruit of the lemon tree and is a mesurable source of citric acid. Vinegar typically contains between 4-7% acidity while lemon juice can contain up to 8% citric acidity. Vinegar has an earthy, acidic taste while lemon juice has a tart, but sweet flavour. Additionally, vinegar can be used as a household cleaner, while lemon juice can be used in the kitchen for various recipes.
